edu.mit.jwi.data
Class FileProvider

java.lang.Object
  edu.mit.jwi.data.FileProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDataProvider, IHasVersion
public class FileProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDataProvider

A basic implementation of the IDataProvider interface for Wordnet that uses files in the file system to back instances of IDataSource. It takes a URL to a file system directory as its path argument, and uses the hints from the IDataType.getResourceNameHints() and POS.getResourceNameHints() interfaces to examine the filenames in the that directory to determine which files contain which data.

Since:
1.5.0
Version:
2.1.5, Nov. 16, 2007
Author:
Mark A. Finlayson

Method Detail

setSource

public void setSource(java.net.URL url)
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
This method must be called with the appropriate URL that directs the file provider to the data that backs the dictionary. If the data provider has already been opened, this call will have no effect until the provider is closed then opened again.

Specified by:

getDirectoryHandle

public java.io.File getDirectoryHandle()
                                throws java.io.IOException
Translates the source URL into a java File object for access to the local filesystem. The URL must be in a UTF-8 compatible format as specified in URLDecoder

Returns:
A File object pointing to the Wordnet dictionary data directory.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if url is null
java.io.IOException - if url does not use the 'file' protocol

containsOneOf

protected boolean containsOneOf(java.lang.String target,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> patterns)
Checks to see if one of the string patterns specified in the set of strings is found in the specified target string. If the pattern set is empty or null, returns true. If a pattern is found in the target string, returns true. Otherwise, returns false.

close

public void close()
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Instructs the provider to dispose of handles to current IDataSource objects and perform any other operations necessary to free the data resources that back the dictionary. A subsequent call to IDataProvider.open() should put the provider in a state where it can again provide IDataSource objects.

Specified by:
close in interface IDataProvider

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Description copied from interface: IDataProvider
Returns true if the provider has finished all of its initialization activities and is ready to return IDataSource objects on command; returns false otherwise.

Specified by:
isOpen in interface IDataProvider
